comments:
After migrating to ECLIPSE Callisto, I'm not able to use any of the
Web content editors anymore. Every time when trying to open such an
Editor, I get the message "SWT Error occured" (with the recommendation
to restart the workbench). Same when trying to switch to a tab containing
such an editor or when using the new file wizard.

I am on AMD64 / Debian testing

Nitin, please check code and see if we should send this to another component (text? swt?) or if its possible we are really doing something wrong?
Hermann, is this limited to the WTP editors (do the plain Text editor and Java editor not complain)?

Yes, java editor, text editor and c++ are fine.

BTW: meanwhile I did a system upgrade to a recent version of
debian testing (gnome 2.14 and the like) -- but the problem
still remains...

Hermann, do you have any additional plugins installed?  The most obvious cause I can find is that there's another plugin trying to provide drop support and our own drag and drop support already being there is causing this error.

(In reply to comment #5)
> Hermann, do you have any additional plugins installed?  The most obvious cause
> I can find is that there's another plugin trying to provide drop support and
> our own drag and drop support already being there is causing this error.

yup! now I could track this down:
It is caused the CDT-Plugin of the current developement line. (either 3.1.1
or 4.0.0). The stable "Callisto" CDT doesn't cause this crash.

(I was forced to switch to the dev line, as the current stable refuses
to handle *.C files as C++ and this breaks the search feature...)

Now, how best to proceed? Can you asiign this bug to CDT in some way or
should I open a new Bug?

PS: I'll post a message to the CDT newsgroup...
See https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=78677#c3 .  Adapting ITextEditor instead of the concrete C editor class has broken our DnD implementation.
I'll take a look at it.

(In reply to comment #9)
> Fixed in HEAD (4.0) > 20060908.

Verified.

Worksforme with org.eclipse.cdt-4.0.0-I200609110500-linux.x86_64
and WebTools (WST) 1.5.0

Can't start eclipse.
